title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message: Hello. Got this board here initially with no power at all. PPBUS_G3H was stuck on 1.6V. After inspection I found corrosion around C2952 area. Cleaned everything and replaced all caps that looked bad and also U8000 that was shorted to GND. Now board gets steady 8.56V on PPBUS_G3H and tries to enter S0. All S0 coils pulse including L7310/20 but after that it goes to 0V again and nothing else. Already inspected whole board for other corrosion points but could not find anything. Where should I look now?

title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Be sure U6101 has good solders.
You may need to clean/remove J6100.

Do you get two pulses on the coils, or power cycling?
Just in case, try to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message: Hello. I get 2 pulses and then 0V on S0 coils. All SPI resistors read OK. Re-soldered U6101 just in case and removed J6100. When in SMC bypass I get quarter fan.

title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message:
Possibly accumulated crap underneath CPU.
Heat it to 180-200 degrees, no more than 15-20s.

May need to reball SMC also.

title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message: Heated CPU for some seconds with original Amtech flus on 200 degrees and reballed SMC. Same thing.

title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message: Do you note pulse at PLT_RESET_L?

title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message: I decided to throw it into US Cleaner to see if there was any crap under big chips. Now after cleaning and drying it up the board is a little different. Now it seems it's power cycling. No fan spin nor quarter fan spin but CPU coils keep pulsing like if it's trying to turn on. PLT_RESET_L seems to pulse also.

title: 820-00165 No Power But S0 Rails Pulse
message:
Very likely CPU problem.
Did you try SMC bypass again?
